Episode 1: The $19.75 Million Question

From the 348,381 documents in the Epstein files comes a story of hidden millions, political power, and secrets that reach the highest offices in the land.

Synopsis

In October 2015, Leon Black—billionaire chairman of Apollo Global Management—wired $19.75 million to Jeffrey Epstein. The money was routed through shell companies with specific instructions to hide Black's name from public records.

Why would one of Wall Street's most powerful figures pay a convicted sex offender nearly $20 million? And what services could Epstein possibly provide to justify such an enormous sum?

This Episode Reveals:

  • The October 2015 Payment: $15M to Southern Trust Company, $4.75M to Epstein's foundation
  • The Shell Company Maze: How the money moved through multiple entities to hide its source
  • The Smoking Gun Email: "In an effort to avoid public disclosure of Leon name..."
  • The Dinner Party from Hell: October 13, 2015—Woody Allen, Soon Yi, Terje Larsen, and Obama White House Counsel Kathy Ruemmler all dining with Jeffrey Epstein

Primary Source Documents

All claims in this episode are based on documents from the Epstein files:

  • EFTA02485037 (October 12, 2015) — $19.75M payment coordination
  • EFTA02485180 (October 13, 2015) — Meeting schedule
  • EFTA02485504 (October 4, 2015) — Dinner guest list

This podcast is based on documents released as part of public records and legal proceedings. All allegations are sourced from primary documents. Opinions expressed are those of the host and guests.
